```{R}
authors <- read_csv("/data/SCIENCE-index/authorsWyears.csv")

authors <- select(authors, careerStartYear, CitationCount) %>% mutate(careerLength = 2023 - careerStartYear) %>% filter(careerLength > 0)

authors <- select(authors, careerLength, CitationCount)
```

```{R}
ggplot(authors, aes(careerLength, CitationCount)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm")

slope <- function(x, y){
  mean_x <- mean(x)
  mean_y <- mean(y)
  nom <- sum((x - mean_x)*(y-mean_y))
  denom <- sum((x - mean_x)^2)
  m <- nom / denom
  return(m)
}
 
# the slope formula is just
# covariance(x, y) / variance(x)
slope2 <- function(x, y){
  return(cov(x, y)/var(x))
}
 
intercept <- function(x, y, m){
  b <- mean(y) - (m * mean(x))
  return(b)
}


my_slope <- slope(authors$careerLength, authors$CitationCount)
myinter <- intercept(authors$careerLength, authors$CitationCount, my_slope)


```
